TopicTitle: My KSP is crashing all the time. What can I do now?

Articles.Content:
It's hard to tell what exactly is happening, as you haven't provided a list of installed mods. The log contains many exceptions and at least one report of a stack overflow. Since the log also reveals you have less than 8GB of RAM in your PC, I suspect that either the number of mods you're using or their size is causing your PC to simply run out of usable memory and crash as a result.

Please read this guide and follow the steps it contains, and if you still have no luck then come back and post the information it asks you to, it will make it a lot easier for someone to help you.

And welcome to the forums!

Without looking at the log, try installing ZeroMiniAVC and see if that helps. 

The old Mini AVC mod which was included in many many mods, got broken in 1. 8, and if it's there you will get many many crashes
Thanks for the help, but my KSP still crashes, even if I don't use mods. My KSP has always worked otherwise.

1 hour ago, PalowPower said:

Thanks for the help, but my KSP still crashes, even if I don't use mods. My KSP has always worked otherwise.

How about provinding a complete Player.log file for analysis?

Also, are you running it from Steam or a standalone install?
I bought it via kerbalspaceprogram.com, cuz i dont really like Steam. So its a Standalone install, and btw. I use both DLC's.
